action.action-desc: Mrs. Miller-Meeks introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend and reauthorize the Staff Sergeant Parker Gordon Fox Suicide Prevention Grant Program of the Department of Veterans Affairs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Wrong Door for Veterans Act.

section.header: Amendments to and reauthorization of the Staff Sergeant Parker Gordon Fox Suicide Prevention Grant Program of the Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Subsection (b) of section 201 of the Commander John Scott Hannon Veterans Mental Health Care Improvement Act of 2019 (Public Law 116–171; 38 U.S.C. 1720F note) is amended, in the second sentence, by striking Office of Mental Health and Suicide Prevention and inserting the Assistant Under Secretary for Health for Clinical Services.

Such section is further amended, in subsection (c)(2)(A), by striking $750,000 per grantee per fiscal year and inserting $500,000 per fiscal year (not more than 5 percent of which may be spent on food and non-alcoholic beverages), plus $10,000 per eligible individual who receives suicide prevention services provided or coordinated by such grantee.

Such section is further amended, in subsection (d)(2), by adding at the end the following: The Secretary shall not give preference to an eligible entity solely because the eligible entity previously received, or applied for, a grant under this section.
Such section is further amended, in subsection (f), by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: An application submitted by an eligible entity that previously received grant funds under this section shall include in such application evidence that the eligible entity used such grant funds to serve a significant number of veterans.

subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (h), by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: Not less than once per calendar quarter, the Secretary shall provide, to the appropriate personnel of each medical center of the Department located not more than 100 miles from the primary location of a grantee, a briefing about the grant program under this section in order to improve coordination between a grantee and such personnel. The Secretary may permit a representative of a grantee to attend such a briefing.

subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (j), by striking the date that is three years after the date on which the first grant is awarded under this section and inserting September 30, 2028.
Such section is further amended, in subsection (n)—

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: an eligible individual receiving suicide prevention services provided or coordinated by such grantee that such eligible individual may receive emergent suicide care under section 1720J of title 38, United States Code; and
the Secretary if such eligible individual requests such emergent suicide care.

subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (p)—

paragraph.text: by striking a total of $174,000,000 for fiscal years 2021 through 2025 and inserting an em dash; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:
for fiscal years 2021 through 2025, a total of $174,000,000; and
for fiscal years 2026 through 2028, a total of $157,500,000.

subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (q)(3)—

paragraph.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting an entity that has continuously provided mental health care or support services in the United States during the two-year period before the date on which the entity applies for a grant under this section, and that is after means; and
in subparagraph (A), by inserting , or a health care provider after foundation.

subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (q)(5), by striking Medical services and inserting The term emergency treatment means medical services.

subsection.header: Required use of screening protocol selected by the Secretary

paragraph.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (q)(11)(A)(ii), by striking screening for risk and inserting screening for risk, using a protocol selected by the Secretary.
In addition to the protocol selected pursuant to the amendment made by paragraph (1)—

subparagraph.text: the Secretary may furnish another protocol to a grantee; and
a grantee may use another protocol to screen for risk.
